Title: Claim cosmic rays harming human bodies through digital devices is a hoax
Claim: Claim: Cosmic rays from outer space will enter Earth between 12:30 am and 3:30 am, around the time of the solar eclipse, and harm human bodies through digital devices. Fact: No scientific evidence exists that cosmic rays can pass through digital devices and harm human bodies. This false claim has circulated online time and again over the past six years. Title: Meteorite, SpaceX Falcon 9 videos passed off as Iranâ€™s retaliation against US, Israel
Claim: Claim: A compilation of three videos shows Iranâ€™s â€œresponseâ€ against the United States and Israel following the April 2024 attack on the Islamic Republicâ€™s consulate in Damascus, Syria. Fact: The footage in question is entirely unrelated to the recent military escalation between Iran and Israel. All videos predate Iranâ€™s 14 April 2024 airstrike on Israel; the first shows an alleged meteorite seen on 4 April, the second depicts the 1 April launch of SpaceX Falcon 9, and the third is a January 2022 clip of rockets that were fired at the US embassy in Baghdad, Iraq. Claim: Claim: A video shows fish flopping around in a few inches of water in a supermarket after rainfall that led to unprecedented flooding in Dubai in April 2024. Fact: The video does not depict Dubai and is unrelated to the April 2024 flooding. It is actually from 2018 when an aquarium reportedly shattered in a supermarket in Tbilisi, Georgia. Claim: Claim: A video on social media shows a 9-year-old Hindu girl, Reshma, who was forcibly abducted and taken to a Sufi shrine, where she was converted to Islam and married to a 45-year-old Muslim man from Jacobabad named Wazir Hussain. Claim: Claim: A foreigner and five Pakistanis were held hostage and robbed on their way to Taxila.Â  Fact: A group of eight people, not six, were robbed on their way back from a hiking trail in Shah Allah Ditta; they were not en route to Taxila. Title: Claims about UN calling for decriminalising sex between adults and minors are false
Claim: Claim: Instagram user @feella.artx has claimed that a March 2023 report is proof the UN has called for the decriminalisation of sexual relations between adults and minors. Fact: The claim is false. A report prepared by the ICJ, UNAIDS, and the OHCHR provides a guideline on the application of criminal laws. It includes suggestions on legislation pertaining to sexual activities, calls for the minimum age of consent laws to be enforced in a non-discriminatory manner, and underlines the human rights impact of criminal laws. However, it has not called for decriminalising sexual relations between adults and minors. On 21 April [â€¦]
